testprocedure.test-case-summary: This test procedure is called by a test case and is used to verify the SUTs support of the dlVideoSwitchControlRequest dialog as an EC using variables provided by the calling test case. This procedure supports verification of requirements related to user need 2.3.5.3.4 [Need to Control a Remote Video Switch] and is used for both valid and invalid test cases.

testStep.functionId: Step 1 CONFIGURE: Determine the Application Layer Standard that will be used for this test. RECORD this information as: ApplicationLayerStandard: ${ApplicationLayerStandard}

Step 2 CONFIGURE: Determine the dialog performance requirement for Send Video Switch Control Response Upon Request (NTRM 3.3.5.4.3.1}. RECORD this value as: TMDD_N34R584_Send_Video_Switch_Control_Response_Upon_Request_Parameter = ${TMDD_N34R584_Send_Video_Switch_Control_Response_Upon_Request_Parameter}

Step 3 CONFIGURE: Determine whether Operator Identifier - Device Control is required by the specification. (NRTM 3.3.5.1.4.1.2.1). RECORD this information as: TMDD_N34R408_Operator_Identifier___Device_Control_Supported = ${TMDD_N34R408_Operator_Identifier___Device_Control_Supported}

Step 4 CONFIGURE: Determine whether Event Identifier - Device Control is required by the specification. (NRTM 3.3.5.1.4.1.2.2). RECORD this information as: TMDD_N34R409_Event_Identifier___Device_Control_Supported = ${TMDD_N34R409_Event_Identifier___Device_Control_Supported}

Step 5 CONFIGURE: Determine whether Event Response Plan - Device Control is required by the specification. (NRTM 3.3.5.1.4.1.2.3). RECORD this information as: TMDD_N34R410_Event_Response_Plan___Device_Control_Supported = ${TMDD_N34R410_Event_Response_Plan___Device_Control_Supported}

Step 6 CONFIGURE: Determine whether Request Priority - Device Control is required by the specification. (NRTM 3.3.5.1.4.1.2.4). RECORD this information as: TMDD_N34R411_Request_Priority___Device_Control_Supported = ${TMDD_N34R411_Request_Priority___Device_Control_Supported}

Step 7 CONFIGURE: Determine whether Control Request Start Date and Time is required by the specification. (NRTM 3.3.5.1.4.1.2.5). RECORD this information as: TMDD_N34R412_Control_Request_Start_Date_and_Time_Supported = ${TMDD_N34R412_Control_Request_Start_Date_and_Time_Supported}

Step 8 CONFIGURE: Determine whether Control Request Expiration Date and Time is required by the specification. (NRTM 3.3.5.1.4.1.2.6). RECORD this information as: TMDD_N34R413_Control_Request_Expiration_Date_and_Time_Supported = ${TMDD_N34R413_Control_Request_Expiration_Date_and_Time_Supported}

Step 9 CONFIGURE: Determine whether Control Request Date and Time Information is required by the specification. (NRTM 3.3.5.1.4.1.2.7). RECORD this information as: TMDD_N34R414_Control_Request_Date_and_Time_Information_Supported = ${TMDD_N34R414_Control_Request_Date_and_Time_Information_Supported}

Step 10 CONFIGURE: Determine whether Text Insertion - Video Switch Control is required by the specification. (NRTM 3.3.5.4.3.2.2.1). RECORD this information as: TMDD_N34R587_Text_Insertion___Video_Switch_Control_Supported = ${TMDD_N34R587_Text_Insertion___Video_Switch_Control_Supported}

Step 11 CONFIGURE: Determine whether Output Channel Lock is required by the specification. (NRTM 3.3.5.4.3.2.2.2). RECORD this information as: TMDD_N34R588_Output_Channel_Lock_Supported = ${TMDD_N34R588_Output_Channel_Lock_Supported}

Step 12 CONFIGURE: Determine whether Frames per Second is required by the specification. (NRTM 3.3.5.4.3.2.2.3). RECORD this information as: TMDD_N34R589_Frames_per_Second_Supported = ${TMDD_N34R589_Frames_per_Second_Supported}

Step 13 CONFIGURE: Determine whether Resolution (Height) is required by the specification. (NRTM 3.3.5.4.3.2.2.4). RECORD this information as: TMDD_N34R590_Resolution__Height__Supported = ${TMDD_N34R590_Resolution__Height__Supported}

Step 14 CONFIGURE: Determine whether Resolution (Width) is required by the specification. (NRTM 3.3.5.4.3.2.2.5). RECORD this information as: TMDD_N34R591_Resolution__Width__Supported = ${TMDD_N34R591_Resolution__Width__Supported}

Step 15 CONFIGURE: Determine whether Video Format is required by the specification. (NRTM 3.3.5.4.3.2.2.6). RECORD this information as: TMDD_N34R592_Video_Format_Supported = ${TMDD_N34R592_Video_Format_Supported}
Step 16 CONFIGURE: Define the response message that will be sent to the SUT. RECORD this information as: ResponseMessage: ${ResponseMessage}
Step 17 CONFIGURE: Determine whether the Authentication parameters need to be verified within this test. RECORD this information as: AuthenticationCheck: ${AuthenticationCheck}
Step 18 CONFIGURE: Identify the Username expected for authentication during this test. RECORD this information as: Username: ${Username}
Step 19 CONFIGURE: Identify the Password expected for authentication during this test. RECORD this information as: Password: ${Password}
Step 20 CONFIGURE: Identify the Operator Identifier expected for authentication during this test. RECORD this information as: OperatorID: ${OperatorID}
Step 21 CONFIGURE: Determine whether the SUT will be allowed access to the information requested in this test. RECORD this information as: AllowAccess: ${AllowAccess}
Step 22 CONFIGURE: Determine whether an error response message is expected for this test. RECORD this information as: ErrorResponseExpected: ${ErrorResponseExpected}
Step 23 CONFIGURE: IF ErrorResponseExpected is true, determine the expected error code response for this test. RECORD this information as: ErrorTypeExpected: ${ErrorTypeExpected}
Step 24 CONFIGURE: Determine whether the SUT is expected to have valid data available for a response message in this test. RECORD this information as: DataValid: ${DataValid}

Step 25 REQUEST-RESPONSE-OC-RECEIVE with the following parameters: DIALOG=dlVideoSwitchControlRequest RESPONSETIMEREQUIRED=TMDD_N34R584_Send_Video_Switch_Control_Response_Upon_Request_Parameter AUTHENTICATIONCHECK = AuthenticationCheck USERNAME = Username PASSWORD = Password OPERATORID = OperatorID ALLOWACCESS = AllowAccess ERRORRESPONSEEXPECTED = ErrorResponseExpected ERRORTYPEEXPECTED = ErrorTypeExpected DATAVALID = DataValid

Step 26 IF ErrorResponseExpected is not equal to TRUE THEN CONTINUE, OTHERWISE skip the following substeps. Note: If a verification step fails, then test execution will proceed at the next subsequent Post Condition step, if present. Otherwise, test execution will proceed to the final Exit step.
Step 26.1 VERIFY that a device-control-request-header data frame exists within message videoSwitchControlRequestMsg.
Step 26.2 VERIFY that an authentication data frame exists within each instance of data frame videoSwitchControlRequestMsg.device-control-request-header
Step 26.3 VERIFY that an organization-requesting data frame exists within each instance of data frame videoSwitchControlRequestMsg.device-control-request-header
Step 26.4 VERIFY that a device-id data element exists within each instance of data frame videoSwitchControlRequestMsg.device-control-request-header
Step 26.5 VERIFY that a request-id data element exists within each instance of data frame videoSwitchControlRequestMsg.device-control-request-header
Step 26.6 VERIFY that a videoSwitchControlRequestMsg message was received.
Step 26.7 VERIFY that a device-control-request-header data frame exists within message videoSwitchControlRequestMsg.
Step 26.8 VERIFY that an input-channel-id data element exists within message videoSwitchControlRequestMsg.
Step 26.9 VERIFY that an output-channel-id data element exists within message videoSwitchControlRequestMsg.
Step 26.10 IF TMDD_N34R408_Operator_Identifier___Device_Control_Supported is equal to TRUE THEN CONTINUE; OTHERWISE skip the following substeps.
Step 26.10.1 VERIFY that an operator-id data element exists within each instance of data frame videoSwitchControlRequestMsg.device-control-request-header.authentication
Step 26.11 IF TMDD_N34R409_Event_Identifier___Device_Control_Supported is equal to TRUE THEN CONTINUE; OTHERWISE skip the following substeps.
Step 26.11.1 VERIFY that an event-id data element exists within each instance of data frame videoSwitchControlRequestMsg.device-control-request-header
Step 26.12 IF TMDD_N34R410_Event_Response_Plan___Device_Control_Supported is equal to TRUE THEN CONTINUE; OTHERWISE skip the following substeps.
Step 26.12.1 VERIFY that a response-plan-id data element exists within each instance of data frame videoSwitchControlRequestMsg.device-control-request-header
Step 26.13 IF TMDD_N34R411_Request_Priority___Device_Control_Supported is equal to TRUE THEN CONTINUE; OTHERWISE skip the following substeps.
Step 26.13.1 VERIFY that a command-request-priority data element exists within each instance of data frame videoSwitchControlRequestMsg.device-control-request-header
Step 26.14 IF TMDD_N34R412_Control_Request_Start_Date_and_Time_Supported is equal to TRUE THEN CONTINUE; OTHERWISE skip the following substeps.
Step 26.14.1 VERIFY that a command-start-time data frame exists within each instance of data frame videoSwitchControlRequestMsg.device-control-request-header
Step 26.15 IF TMDD_N34R413_Control_Request_Expiration_Date_and_Time_Supported is equal to TRUE THEN CONTINUE; OTHERWISE skip the following substeps.
Step 26.15.1 VERIFY that a command-end-time data frame exists within each instance of data frame videoSwitchControlRequestMsg.device-control-request-header
Step 26.16 IF TMDD_N34R414_Control_Request_Date_and_Time_Information_Supported is equal to TRUE THEN CONTINUE; OTHERWISE skip the following substeps.
Step 26.16.1 VERIFY that a command-request-time data frame exists within each instance of data frame videoSwitchControlRequestMsg.device-control-request-header
Step 26.17 IF TMDD_N34R587_Text_Insertion___Video_Switch_Control_Supported is equal to TRUE THEN CONTINUE; OTHERWISE skip the following substeps.
Step 26.17.1 VERIFY that a channel-titling-text data element exists within message videoSwitchControlRequestMsg.
Step 26.18 IF TMDD_N34R588_Output_Channel_Lock_Supported is equal to TRUE THEN CONTINUE; OTHERWISE skip the following substeps.
Step 26.18.1 VERIFY that a set-output-channel-lock data element exists within message videoSwitchControlRequestMsg.
Step 26.19 IF TMDD_N34R589_Frames_per_Second_Supported is equal to TRUE THEN CONTINUE; OTHERWISE skip the following substeps.
Step 26.19.1 VERIFY that a frames-per-second data element exists within message videoSwitchControlRequestMsg.
Step 26.20 IF TMDD_N34R590_Resolution__Height__Supported is equal to TRUE THEN CONTINUE; OTHERWISE skip the following substeps.
Step 26.20.1 VERIFY that a frame-height-pixels data element exists within message videoSwitchControlRequestMsg.
Step 26.21 IF TMDD_N34R591_Resolution__Width__Supported is equal to TRUE THEN CONTINUE; OTHERWISE skip the following substeps.
Step 26.21.1 VERIFY that a frame-width-pixels data element exists within message videoSwitchControlRequestMsg.
Step 26.22 IF TMDD_N34R592_Video_Format_Supported is equal to TRUE THEN CONTINUE; OTHERWISE skip the following substeps.
Step 26.22.1 VERIFY that a video-format data element exists within message videoSwitchControlRequestMsg.
Step 26.23 VERIFY that the values within the REQUEST message are correct per the TMDD standard and known operational conditions.

USER-VERIFY-MESSAGE.functionId: The User Verifies the message content

testStep.functionId: Step 26.24 CONFIGURE: Set CONTENTVERIFIED to True

Step 26.25 POSTCONDITION: REQUEST-RESPONSE-OC-REPLY with the following parameters: DIALOG=dlVideoSwitchControlRequest RESPONSETIMEREQUIRED=TMDD_N34R584_Send_Video_Switch_Control_Response_Upon_Request_Parameter CONTENTVERIFIED = CONTENTVERIFIED RESPONSEMESSAGE = ResponseMessage
Step 27 EXIT
